intro: Ruellia venosa, commonly known as the veined ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins that give it its common name. Its flowers are tubular and come in shades of blue, purple, or white, often arranged in clusters. Ruellia venosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
